hypothesis_content.title: Post-Halving Memecoin Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, following a period of low volatility (BTC 20-day realized volatility < 40%), a sudden spike in social volume for 'memecoin' and 'Solana meme' terms will trigger a breakout in memecoin implied volatility (IV), leading to a predictable short-volatility (sell option premium) opportunity in SOL memecoins after the initial IV spike.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral, low-vol markets often see meme-driven IV spikes that are not sustained by actual price movement, as hype fades quickly. This creates a mean-reversion opportunity in options pricing.
entry_conditions: Social volume for memecoin-related terms spikes > 150% over 24h rolling average
Aggregate IV for SOL memecoin options (derived from major protocols) spikes > 20% in 24h
Enter SHORT volatility (e.g., sell strangle) at market open following the IV spike confirmation

exit_conditions.take_profit: IV reverts to pre-spike levels (or 50% of the spike retraced)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price moves > 7% in either direction from entry (volatility expands further)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The IV spike is sustained or increases alongside a trending price move in memecoins, indicating a genuine volatility regime shift.
